messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] The check's in the mail
messages.msgSnippet: that is a great story! Priceless, really! sognokids@aol.com wrote:   When we received a new box of checks in the mail today, I was reminded of something that
messages.messageBody:
that is a great story! Priceless, really!
sognokids@... wrote: When we received a new box of checks in the mail today, I was reminded of
something that happened a few years ago with my eldest, Colton. We'd gotten
a batch of checks from the bank that had been incorrectly imprinted. We were
going to throw the checks away, but Colton asked if he could have a couple
packs and if I would show him how to fill them out. I did, and for the next
few days I received checks from Colton written as payment for everything from
macaroni and cheese dinners to clean laundry.

One morning I woke up very early, long before anyone else was up. I came
downstairs, made some tea, and settled on the sofa with a blanket to read.
When I opened my book, a check fluttered to the floor. It was made out to
me, in the amount of $22.00. Written in the bottom left corner in the memo
section were two miraculous words: For love.

I still have the check and I will keep it forever. But it's worth a lot
more to me than $22.00. It's priceless.

Carol

Angela ~ who doesn't actually pay many bills with checks anymore.

Why limit it just to play? ~Mary

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] The check's in the mail
messages.msgSnippet: zenmomma *  wrote: Why limit it just to play? Casey often writes out the checks when I m paying the bills. She enters it in the checkbook
messages.messageBody:
zenmomma * <zenmomma@...> wrote:

Why limit it just to play? Casey often writes out the checks when I'm paying
the bills. She enters it in the checkbook and stuffs the envelopes too. I
just supervise and sign them.

Good idea, I usally pay my bills online but I could always have them prewrite them when I go to get gas or something. :)

Tracy

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] The check's in the mail
messages.msgSnippet: ... Why limit it just to play? Casey often writes out the checks when I m paying the bills. She enters it in the checkbook and stuffs the envelopes too. I just
messages.messageBody:
>>My girls went through a phase of check writing. At first I gave them some
>>checks from a bank we didn't use anymore. Then I photocopied our checks.
>>Then I found a place online to print checks and I could add their name to
>>them. They were just for play and they really enjoyed it.>>

Why limit it just to play? Casey often writes out the checks when I'm paying
the bills. She enters it in the checkbook and stuffs the envelopes too. I
just supervise and sign them.

Life is good.
~Mary

"The miracle is not to walk on water. The miracle is to walk on the green
earth, dwelling deeply in the present moment and feeling truly alive."

~ Thich Nhat Hanh

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] The check's in the mail
messages.msgSnippet: That s sweet!.  My girls went through a phase of check writing.  At first I gave them some checks from a bank we didn t use anymore.  Then I photocopied our
messages.messageBody:
That's sweet!. My girls went through a phase of check writing. At
first I gave them some checks from a bank we didn't use anymore. Then I
photocopied our checks. Then I found a place online to print checks and
I could add their name to them. They were just for play and they really
enjoyed it. I am sure a quick search would find something similar if
anyone was interested.

Angela

I still have the check and I will keep it forever. But it's worth a
lot
more to me than $22.00. It's priceless.

Carol

messages.messageBody:
Precious. :)
I got some of the little toy checks by parentbanc that are very much
like real checks.{I had forgotton about them) I went and couldn't
find them on the web just now but parentbank does have a web site of
their own. (I think I think I got mine at etoys and they were on sale
really cheap}
Thanks for posting this. Maybe I'll scan a few and print them off for
thew kids to play with over and over and over...
This will take you to what they look like {but it may be cheeper to
get regualar checks if anyone is interested in this for their kids -
LOL}
http://www.parentbanc.com/images/products/product_detail/pb_pbchkbook_
burst.gif
Tracy

messages.subject: The check's in the mail
messages.msgSnippet: When we received a new box of checks in the mail today, I was reminded of something that happened a few years ago with my eldest, Colton.  We d gotten a batch
messages.messageBody:
When we received a new box of checks in the mail today, I was reminded of
something that happened a few years ago with my eldest, Colton. We'd gotten
a batch of checks from the bank that had been incorrectly imprinted. We were
going to throw the checks away, but Colton asked if he could have a couple
packs and if I would show him how to fill them out. I did, and for the next
few days I received checks from Colton written as payment for everything from
macaroni and cheese dinners to clean laundry.

One morning I woke up very early, long before anyone else was up. I came
downstairs, made some tea, and settled on the sofa with a blanket to read.
When I opened my book, a check fluttered to the floor. It was made out to
me, in the amount of $22.00. Written in the bottom left corner in the memo
section were two miraculous words: For love.

I still have the check and I will keep it forever. But it's worth a lot
more to me than $22.00. It's priceless.

Carol
